cold_snaps.status: At present, there is no cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps occur annually.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference so far is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: At present, there is no heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves occur annually.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Ranked 8th for rainfall today's storm had precipitation totalling 13.04mm, falling at 8.6mm per hour at times during the 7.9 hour long storm.  The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 27.64mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 15.9 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking first from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 23 November 2024, it lasted 23.2 hours, delivered 24.56mm of rain at a maximum rate of 6.4mm per hour.
Active storm detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (205°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.76 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1603 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 13.4m lower than yesterday, 500.6m lower than the past week, 1603.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 1053.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and little or no wind. Moderate rainfall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
